page.title: 01Rothley and Longwitton
page.content: This area on western side consists of rocky crags, at one time a deer park. In 18th century Sir Walter Blackett had two follies constructed, Codgers Castle, on the Alemouth road, might have been militry. Rothley Castle was an ornamental eyecatcher. Rothley Lakes were designed by Capability Brown. Later came the railway now disused. There has been much mining and quarrying with recent opencast. Cottages have at times extended along all the road to Longwitton, housing miners and quarrymen. Deserted medieval villages are at Rothley and Longwitton.Forestry covers some mining areas The only transport is school buses and no amenities.Farms rear sheep and cattle,with little corn on lower ground. Rothle Farm hs a plastic tunnel for sheep-lambing and Longwitton Farm has large,new sheds
